column4: Does anybody know why Gnome every couple of hours or so randomly logouts?
Is there a hotkey I may accidentally be pressing?
Although the last time I wasn't even touching the keyboard.
Is there a Linux command that I can use to restart services (e.g apache)
yes
Ok, thank you.
don't u want to know the command? ;)
Not if you wern't going to give it without making me fine tune my question, at least I know it exists now eh? :)
Okay yeah, what is it. :)
there are 2 ways i know.. i'll tell you both
both only work with sudo (ore as root)
That's expected, you're dealing with system services.
1) maybe you have a command calld apachctl or apache2ctl?
Yes.
e.g. apache2ctl restet <--- done ;)
and the cgray was even faster then me >_<
cgray, appreciate it.
/etc/init.d/apache restart
It doesn't seem to work, oddly.
witch command?
/etc/init.d/apache2 restart <- don't forget the 2 ;)
try with TAB, to find out how it's calles
